citation.article-title: Thermocladium modestius gen. nov., sp. nov., a new genus of rod-shaped, extremely thermophilic crenarchaeote.

p.s: Description of Thermocladium modestius sp. nov.
Thermocladium modestius (mo.des'ti.us. L. comp. adj. modestior (neut. modestius) modester, referring to the growth temperature range)
Growth is stimulated by CO2 in the gas phase and by archaeal cell-extract or a vitamin mixture.
Growth occurs at 45-82°C and is optimal around 75°C.
Growth occurs at pH 26-51 and is optimal at pH 4.0 when buffered with 10 mM trisodium citrate.
Growth pH is extended to pH 5.9 when buffered with 10mM MES.
Under optimal conditions [75°C, pH 4.2, under H2/CO2 (4: 1, v/v; 100 kPa) gas mixture], strain IC-125T grows with a doubling time of 15-18 h.
Utilizes glycogen, starch, beef extract, casamino acids, peptone, malt extract, tryptone and yeast extract as carbon sources.
Grows best with 0.1-0.2% yeast extract, but does not grow with 1.0% yeast extract.
Requires sulfur, thiosulfate, L-cystine or sulfate as electron acceptors.
With H2/CO2 (4: 1, v/v; 100 kPa) as gas phase, may utilize nitrate or FeCl, as electron acceptors.
The G + C content of genomic DNA is 52 mol %.
The type strain, IC-125T (= JCM 100MT), was isolated from solfataric mud at Noji-onsen, Fukushima, Japan.
Two additional strains, IC-139 (= JCM 10089) and IC-142 (=JCM 10090), are also included in this species.
